Tl;dr: It's a decent hack 'n' slash game with good artwork, can get repetitive, made primarily for mobile devices, DON'T BUY IT ON STEAM SINCE IT'S FREE ON DESURA. Read below for more info.I bought this game months ago (during a sale, phew!), and at first I remember I loved it. I loved the artwork, I loved the hack 'n' slash. I simply found this through browsing Steam, not their Kickstarter. I used to love just hacking and slashing, one downside was that to get better loots you have to do the same missions a few times with higher difficulty, just like other games, but this one doesn't make the higher difficulty more fun, it's rather boring to do it again and again in fact. (Which it still is now.)As of writing this on November 11, 2014, yes, this game is free on Desura. Yes, there is micro-transaction, which is because this game was supposed to come out on iOS and Android as well. However, reading the comment section of their Kickstarter, there isn't any news on the phone versions yet. The weird controls are a result of this game being primarily a mobile game. You only use mouse left and right clicks which can be extremely irritating if you normally use WASD to move around.The developing team is literally 1 person alone, and he had 2.7k people back the game with a total amount of 200k USD. Despite that, I didn't have high hopes after downloading it again today. In August, 2014, in which he replied comments on Akaneiro's Kickstarter, the developer explained the slow progress was due to him being alone in the whole development, HOWEVER, after the Kickstarter success in February 2013, he had since 1 failed and 1 successful Kickstarter campaign, both on different projects, with the latest successful one in August, 2013. So is he slacking off on developing this game?I was fine with just going along and playing the game like I used to. However, I couldn't even load the one mission I wanted to play... I'm sorry but for now, I cannot recommend this game, especially since it's made for mobile WITHOUT controls for PC players, and its horrible development.

												I blame Okami, I love that game and when I saw this game...well the awful reviews hadn't fully come in yet.  So I thought "Yeah a Diabloesque beat'em up that looks like Okami, but with Little Red Riding Hood as a demonhunter instead of the goddess Amaterasu as a wolf." And the makers of this game have essentially given up on this game and say they have gutted their Akaneiro crew to two programmers spending time to deal with the huge problems in this game.  Yikes...considering how much difficulty they have with their new games elsewhere, you can expect a patch for this game a decade from now. This game has beautiful artwork and a nice if rather empty pseudo-Japanese styling (I've seen larger and more active town populations in old SNES RPGs and the first Diablo than this game).  That's the only positive to this game.  Otherwise this game is mired down in a ton of problems and isn't going to improve.  I have only one purchase regret for Steam and it's this game.

The art style reminds me of Japanese paintings, the traditional sounding music fits the atmosphere perfectly, and the pacing has been good.I was surprised to hear that the game has a lot in common with Bastion, but after seeing how they did the town I can see it.At this point in early access the game is designed to start sending you back to the earlier areas at higher difficulties to allow you to grind xp and items. Enemy variety has been good for the early part of the game, but the maps appear to be static. I have always felt that randomized areas help give dungeon crawlers longevity so it'll be interesting to see what they do.I suggest starting with the Fortitude character, currency is shared as well as the stash so if you decide to have multiple characters it's easy to pass stuff between them.It also appears that you can summon an ally, even if offline, and they will get rewards for it. Very cool concept.

The little chat box at the bottom lay barren, devoid of any purpose as there was nary a soul to talk to.  The game-play itself isn't bad, it plays a lot like guild wars.
